description.narrative: The proposed Project consists of a senior loan of up to US$10 million, denominated in local currency, to Kyrgyz Investment and Credit Bank (KICB or the Bank), a long-standing IFC client and a systemically important bank in the Kyrgyz Republic. The tenor of the loan is 4-year with 18-month grace period. Local currency financing at a commercially viable rate will be provided via The International Development Associations Private Sector Window Local Currency Facility (IDA PSW LCF). Investment proceeds will be used to increase access to finance for micro finance institutions (MFIs), underserved individuals and micro enterprises (MEs) in the Kyrgyz Republic, with a particular focus on sustaining affordable housing finance for low-income individuals and financing to women-owned MEs.
